content: finishing the doors and windows follow the same finishing step 1 first insert your cast off end into the center of your door or window and out through the bottom hole see figure a your cast off end should now be hanging out the bottom hole step 2 knot the 2 ends together this will help flatten your project step 3 now that you are finished with your cast off end you can hide it inside your door or window step 4 use the cast on end to embroider decorations on your door and windows the doorknob is made with a french knot the window frame with 2 long stitches my window frame often takes a few tries before i get it in the position i like step 5 sew the bottom hole shut with your cast on end by make a running stitch around the hole and pulling tightly hide end inside of project that s all hope they bring you joy figure a front back chimney instructions cast on 12 sts divide the sts over 2 dpns and join to work in the round r1-12 knit cast off cut yarn finishing step 1 weave in both ends on the right/knit side see why on step 2 step 2 flip inside out step 3 stuff with fleece/stuffing for smoke please note to keep my chimney upright on roof i put a toothpick up the center and stab in ground diy hobbit hole for photo tutorial see page 5 supplies needed garden trowel and some extra dirt step 1 prepare the area by trimming the grass the back half will be the roof the front half will be the front yard given how small my knits are i like to pick a mossy area so my knits aren t covered by grass step 2 dig under the grass turf of the roof all the way along to make an opening for the dirt to go underneath i go about as deep as the length of my trowel step 3 make opening by pulling the grass upward your project should now resemble a cave step 4 insert dirt into hole because loose dirt is fiddly i like to cut a slice of turf and hide the grass end in the back of the hole this way it keeps its structure better make sure your hobbit hole is big enough to fit your windows and door step 5 tidy up your hobbit hole this may mean adding moss to areas that look bare or smoothing down dirt at the front step 6 add your beautiful knitting toothpicks are great at helping you keep the windows up and especially good with keeping the chimney in place 4 photo tutorial step 1 prepare location by trimming grass step 2 use trowel to create opening step 3 lever up to make bigger opening step 4 insert dirt into hole step 5 tidy up step 6 add your beautiful knitting 5
